name: bone giant cell tumor
definition: A giant cell tumor and bone cancer and bone tissue neoplasm that results_in the presence of multinucleated giant cells (osteoclast-like cell). [url:http\://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giant_cell_tumor_of_bone]

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Velcade (Bortezomib) treatment resulted in decreased NF-kappaB signaling, increased apoptosis, and decreased growth of bone giant cell tumor cells in culture, and decreased bone giant cell tumor cell-mediated bone destruction in mouse models (PMID: 26861247).

references.title: Bortezomib Inhibits Giant Cell Tumor of Bone through Induction of Cell Apoptosis and Inhibition of Osteoclast Recruitment, Giant Cell Formation, and Bone Resorption.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II clinical trial that supported FDA approval, Xgeva (denosumab) treatment resulted in an overall objective response rate of 25% (47/187) in patients with giant cell bone tumor, with a median duration of response of 20 months among patients demonstrating response (PMID: 25617146).

references.title: Giant cell tumour of bone: new treatments in development.

clinicalTrials.title: Study of Denosumab in Subjects With Giant Cell Tumor of Bone
Long-term Safety Follow-up of Subjects With Giant Cell Tumor of Bone Treated With Denosumab in Study 20062004
